intro: Malapoenna miqueliana, commonly known as the Malapoenna miqueliana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
